TopicTitle: Can i manually apply mods to higher versions than supported?

Articles.Content:
Is there any way to do that? I am using KSP 1.4.2 and many great mods are not updated to this version. It really annoys me, especially because i am not sure if the mod creators are willing to update them. So, could i do it myself?

Edited May 19, 2018 by LusBax
Spelling mistake

Well, I'm not 100% sure on what exactly you are asking, but I'll try to answer both, at least to point you in the right direction.

1) You can try to use an older mod on a newer version of KSP.  It might work, it might not.  You'll just have to try and see.

2) You can try to take the source code and recompile the mod for the current version yourself.  This would involve getting your hands on the API and such, but I'm not familiar with  the details, so somebody else will have to point you in the right direction there.    But again, this is a crapshoot.   The code for the older mod may not be compatible with the current KSP, even with a recompile.   If you do get it to work, I would suggest creating a fork and posting it in the mod thread, as there are surely others who want this too.
